error.signature: error: object file .git/objects/ab/cdef1234 is empty; error: unable to read sha1 file of file.txt
error.regex: (?i)(?:object file.*is empty|unable to read sha1|corrupt.*object|object.*corrupt|inflate.*data stream error)

verdict.summary: A git object file is empty, truncated, or contains invalid data. Typically caused by disk corruption, power loss during write, filesystem bugs, or aggressive antivirus software modifying files in .git/objects.

dead_ends.action: Deleting the corrupted object file manually
dead_ends.why_fails: Removing the object breaks any references to it; git cannot reconstruct the object without additional information. This can make the corruption worse.

dead_ends.action: Running git gc to fix the corrupted object
dead_ends.why_fails: gc cannot repair corrupted objects; it may fail entirely when it encounters the corrupt data during repacking

workarounds.action: Fetch the missing/corrupted object from the remote
workarounds.how: Remove the empty/corrupt object file: rm .git/objects/ab/cdef1234. Then git fetch origin to re-download the object from the remote. Verify with git fsck.

workarounds.action: Re-clone the repository preserving local branches
workarounds.how: Export local-only work: git format-patch origin/main..my-branch. Clone fresh: git clone <url> fresh-repo. Apply patches: git am *.patch in the fresh clone.

leads_to.condition: when corrupted objects cause broken references in the object graph
when the corrupted object is in the HEAD commit chain

preceded_by.condition: when interrupted gc operations leave partially written objects
when failed pack indexing leaves corrupt loose objects

frequently_confused_with.distinction: object-corrupted means an object exists but its content is invalid; fsck-broken-link means a referenced object is completely missing
